description:
Mayumi Doujima is a young girl who has been searching for a star that she saw only once ten years ago. She visits the headquarters of the Pretty Boy Detective Club where she meets five boys who are each unique in their own way. Her encounter marks the beginning of an extraordinary search for a lost star. A beautiful and dazzling mystery-adventure story starts now!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: ขบวนการนักสืบหนุ่มรูปงาม

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

node.description:
[Website](http://ni.siois.in) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/NISIOISIN_info)

NISIOISIN, whose pen name is a palindrome, is a Japanese novelist and manga writer. He attended and left Ritsumeikan University without graduating. In 2002, he debuted with the novel _Kubikiri Cycle_, which earned him the 23rd Mephisto Award at 20 years of age. 

He currently works for Kodansha on Pandora, the Kodansha Box magazine, and Faust, a literary magazine containing the works of other young authors who similarly take influence from light novels and otaku culture. He was also publishing a 12-volume series over 12 months for the Kodansha Box line; fellow author Ryusui Seiryoin was matching this output, and the Kodansha Box website stated that this is the first time in the world two authors have written 12-volume monthly novel series simultaneously for the same publisher.
[Website](https://marubotan.jimdo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kamabokoita) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=604755)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_kaele)

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined an adult game brand (スタジオルクス) which he soon left. He entered [Studio Pastoral](https://anilist.co/studio/299/Studio-Pastoral) after which he started working on [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft) shows and became part of the main staff for most of their works.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)
Formerly affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
Originating from [Group TAC](https://anilist.co/studio/86/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_kaele)

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined an adult game brand (スタジオルクス) which he soon left. He entered [Studio Pastoral](https://anilist.co/studio/299/Studio-Pastoral) after which he started working on [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft) shows and became part of the main staff for most of their works.
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Aichi Institute of Technology

**[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/masatomo-ota/)** | **[Artist Profile (First Call Music)](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/%e5%a4%aa%e7%94%b0%e9%9b%85%e5%8f%8b/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatomoota)**

**Masatomo Oota** is a Japanese guitarist and musician, who does composition and arrangement for anime. He is a part of the two-piece music unit [SCREEN mode](https://anilist.co/staff/119992/SCREEN-mode), and has been since 2013.
Rie Matsubara does editing.
__[Website](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/effy/)__ | __Twitter__ Effy (real name Kousuke Moribe) is a producer, composer, arranger and keyboardist afilliated with FirstCall.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)

sumika is a four-person rock band from Kawasaki, Japan consisting of [Kataoka Kenta](https://anilist.co/staff/175649) (Vocals, Guitar), Kuroda Junnosuke (Guitar, Chorus). Arai Tomoyuki (Drums), and Ogawa Takayuki (Keyboard, Chorus)

**Height:** 176 cm (5'9)

[Website](https://www.toshikimasuda.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshikiMasuda38) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/toshi.m38/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx47ourWgyHf3iAl77MYY0g/featured)

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Rover - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Masayoshi Tanimura - Yakuza 4 Remastered

**Height:** 172cm

[Website](https://muraseayumu.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/murase_pipipi)

In 2016, he won Best Male Rookie at the 10th Seiyu Awards.

On May 1, 2023, he announced that he was leaving his previous talent agency VIMS to start his own, Aster Nine.

**Non anime roles:**

- [Venti](https://anilist.co/character/187525/) - Genshin Impact (Video game)
- [Mizuki](https://anilist.co/character/292633/) - Arknights (Video game)
- Don Murasame - Avataro Sentai Donbrothers (Tokusatsu series)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=36) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/StoickerGEN) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqNGnIZtXDJmTZPrPu7aPPg)

Recipient of the Newcomer Award at the 16th Seiyuu Awards.
[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/men/bantaito/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TaitoB_1218)

[Profile](http://www.set1979.com/member/profile/a77yano.php) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yano_0319)

On August 31st, 2022, he announced that he got married to a woman unconnected to the entertainment industry.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/136694891) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amanokiyoyuki)

A creative director and producer.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
